intro: Leonotis mollis, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the mallow family (Malvaceae) and is characterized by its striking spikes of tubular, red-orange flowers. The plant is evergreen and can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy to the touch. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The flowers attract bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological value.
